title: Fixed TestCqlshOutput failing tests - 3.0

See https://github.com/apache/cassandra/pull/1450 for context.

title: Fixed TestCqlshOutput failing tests - 3.11
body:
Patch by Aleksei Zotov; reviewed by Ekaterina Dimitrova for CASSANDRA-17386

Looks like the root cause is related to the "width of output" when cqlsh prints it. I've tried to find the commit at started the issues appeared from and it is reproducible in 3.11.4 (probably even earlier, but I stopped on this version). I doubt the problem was actual back then. Looks like it is somewhow related to either cqlsh internals or to some environmental magic (e.g. Python internals).

Anyway this problem was fixed in 4.0 as a part of the below commit:
https://github.com/apache/cassandra/commit/bf9a1d487b9ba469e8d740cf7d1cd419535a7e79#diff-4f28d77309cd96fadc18b2e74fb7a0c2c040ec6e68e551e1198eb2361c8a56a7R56. I pulled the necessary changes.

title: Upgrade from nose, which is no longer maintained, to pytest
body:
This is a minimalist upgrade to use the pytest framework.  It uses backward compatibility with nose to maintain nose imports.

Several tests had to be updated or fixed, which seemed unrelated to the pytest upgrade.  With these changes, pytest runs a clean set of tests.

% pytest
========================================================================== test session starts ===========================================================================
platform darwin -- Python 3.9.10, pytest-7.0.0, pluggy-1.0.0

title: CASSANDRA-17347 Fix NullPointerException during StartupClusterConnectivityChecker
body:
A NullPointerException is possible when the StartupClusterConnectivityChecker fails,
and one of the missing peers has been added/discovered after the initialization of
the map between peers and datacenters. This is causing in some rare instances the
NullPointerException because an "element cannot be mapped to a null key".

This commit prevents the NullPointerException, by checking the map first for the DC
and if it's null, it calls the `getDatacenterSource` function, which is a call to
the `DatabaseDescriptor.getEndpointSnitch()::getDatacenter` method.

title: CASSANDRA-17295: Make vtables accessible via internode messaging
CASSANDRA-17002: Virtual table for gossip info
body:
This commit adds a new virtual table that exposes the gossip information in tabular format.

The information is the same as the information presented through the `nodetool gossipinfo`
command, but the virtual table splits the version and value from `VersionedValue` into two
different columns. This is intented to help clients reading the vtable without the need of
parsing the version:value information (as it currently stands in gossipinfo).

The token value does not have a column. This is consistent with the gossipinfo output which
always renders ":<hidden>" for the Token value. Only the token_version column is available.

title: CASSANDRA-17266 Remove default_time_to_live for Views in describe
body:
Remove default_time_to_live in the describe output for views as it is
not supported by them. Updated to pass the isView variable to the
CqlBuilder.

Fixes: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-17266

title: Fix classpath file creation for eclipse
body:
When building the eclipse file for development, `.classpath` file was
not correctly generated as it was not getting closed. Also there were
missing third-party libs that were essential for development.

This commit fixes the generation of classpath for
`generate-eclipse-files` command.

Issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-17294

title: CASSANDRA-17224: Virtual table for exposing CQL metrics
body:
Exposing CQL metrics to a virtual table. 

Below are CQL metrics from https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/cassandra/operating/metrics.html#:~:text=org.apache.cassandra.metrics%3Atype%3DCQL,that%20are%20prepared%20vs%20unprepared.

Name | Type | Description
-- | -- | --
PreparedStatementsCount | Gauge<Integer> | Number of cached prepared statements.
PreparedStatementsEvicted | Counter | Number of prepared statements evicted from the prepared statement cache
PreparedStatementsExecuted | Counter | Number of prepared statements executed.
RegularStatementsExecuted | Counter | Number of non prepared statements executed.
PreparedStatementsRatio | Gauge<Double> | Percentage of statements that are prepared vs unprepared.


Here is the virtual table created with this diff, output from cqlsh:

```
cqlsh> select * from system_views.cql_metrics ;

 name                         | value
------------------------------+-------
    prepared_statements_count |     0
  prepared_statements_evicted |     0
 prepared_statements_executed |     0
    prepared_statements_ratio |     0
  regular_statements_executed |    17

(5 rows)
```

3.0: CASSANDRA-17272
Decommission previously deprecated python 2 support
body:
These changes remove support for Python 2 from the CQLSH code base.  Python 2 has been declared End of Life by it's maintainers at Python.org.

Python 2.7.0 was released on July 3rd, 2010 and reached EOL on January 1st, 2021. It is no longer maintained by Python.org and contains known security vulnerability which have not and will not be patched by the maintainers of the Python language.

See the full statement at https://www.python.org/doc/sunset-python-2/
